ETYMOLOGY: From Old English brecan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch breken and German brechen.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The time when light first appears; dawn or the beginning of a period.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 破晓；黎明；（某一时间段的）开始。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We started our journey at the break of day to avoid the heat.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 为了避开酷热，我们从破晓时分就开始了旅程。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To separate into pieces suddenly or violently; to smash or fracture.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He accidentally broke the vase while cleaning.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他打扫时，不小心把花瓶打碎了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A pause in work or during an activity; a short rest period.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We took a short coffee break after the meeting.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 会议结束后，我们休息了一会儿喝咖啡。
